result.execSummary:
The defendant Irene Nmi Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: First 60 days Straight Time (Jail) remaining time Huber with standard release conditions. Credit For Time Served 4 Days (to be used with Huber part of sentence).

miscConds.notes: Cash Bail Applied.  Paid In Full.  The remaining bail was refunded to the poster.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Be involved in 12 step program 2 times per week within 30 days and within 60 days have a sponsor.
Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Sign any/all Medical Releases for Agent.
Obtain a valid driver's license.
Operate a motor vehicle with a valid driver's license.
Maintain/Obtain full time activity.
No contact with any BonTon Store and Boston Store in Southeastern Wisconsin.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time:  20 day Huber - Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED and to be used at the Agent's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Irene Nmi Taylor
